words.definition: To accompany other people means to join them.
words.example: My brothers accompanied me to the movie.

words.definition: When something is bare, it is plain and has no covering.
words.example: He likes to walk around in his bare feet.

words.definition: A branch is the part of a tree with leaves.
words.example: The monkey was hanging from a branch.

words.definition: A breath is the air that goes into and out of one's lungs.
words.example: He took a deep breath before he started to run.

words.definition: A bridge is something built over a river or road.
words.example: We drove across the bridge to get to the city.

words.definition: To cast is to throw something.
words.example: The fisherman cast his line into the water.

words.definition: To dare is to be brave enough to do something.
words.example: He dared to jump off the high diving board.

words.definition: When something is electronic, it uses electricity.
words.example: I like to play electronic games.

words.definition: An inn is a small place where people can stay.
words.example: We stayed at a cozy inn for the night.

words.definition: A net is used to catch fish or birds.
words.example: He used a net to catch a butterfly.

words.definition: Philosophy is a way of thinking about life.
words.example: My philosophy is to always be kind.

words.definition: A pot is a deep container used for cooking.
words.example: She put the soup in a large pot.

words.definition: A seed is the part of a plant from which a new plant grows.
words.example: I planted a sunflower seed in the garden.

words.definition: When something is sharp, it has a thin edge that cuts.
words.example: The knife is very sharp, so be careful.

words.definition: A sort is a type of something.
words.example: What sort of music do you like?

words.definition: To subtract is to take something away from a number.
words.example: If you subtract two from five, you get three.

words.definition: When something is tight, it is firm or close.
words.example: My shoes are too tight for my feet.

words.definition: If something is virtual, it is made by a computer.
words.example: The game has a virtual world you can explore.

words.definition: To weigh is to see how heavy something is.
words.example: The cat weighs five kilograms.

words.definition: To whisper is to speak very quietly.
words.example: She whispered a secret in my ear.
